Former President Jimmy Carter is speaking out about the hotly contested governor's race in his home state of Georgia
From member station WAMC in Atlanta Johnny Kauffman reports Carter a Democrat is calling on the Republican in the rates Brian Kemp to step aside from also overseeing the state's election
In a letter the former president urges gubernatorial candidate Brian Kemp to pass responsibility for these midterms to a neutral authority
Carter says popular confidence in Georgia's elections is threatened because of the history of racial discrimination in that state and questions about the security of Georgia's electronic voting machines
Democrats in civil rights groups have accused secretary of state Brian Kemp of suppressing the vote for political gain Kemp campaign called Carter's letter a publicity stunt and says his opponent in the Georgia governor's race Democrats Abrams is using the former president to
